hints_html:
Set

\[\begin{aligned} A = \left[\begin{array}{cc} a & b \\ c & d \end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]

and calculate

\[\begin{aligned} \left[\begin{array}{cc} a & b \\ c & d \end{array}\right] \left[\begin{array}{c} s\\t \end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]

Matching one-by-one will give you the values of a, b, c and d.
hints_raw:
Set
:<math>
A = \left[\begin{array}{cc}
a & b \\ c & d
\end{array}\right]
</math>
and calculate
:<math>
\left[\begin{array}{cc}
a & b \\ c & d
\end{array}\right] \left[\begin{array}{c} s\\t \end{array}\right]
</math>
Matching one-by-one will give you the values of ''a'', ''b'', ''c'' and ''d''.
question: A 16
sols_html:
Following the hint gives us

\[\begin{aligned} \left[\begin{array}{cc} a & b \\ c & d \end{array}\right]\left[\begin{array}{c} s\\t \end{array}\right] &= \left[\begin{array}{c} as+bt \\ cs+dt \end{array}\right] = s\left[\begin{array}{c} a \\ c\end{array}\right] + t\left[\begin{array}{c} b \\ d\end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]

Comparing to the original equation gives

\[\begin{aligned} A = \left[\begin{array}{cc} 1 & 3 \\ 2 & -1 \end{array}\right]\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
Following the hint gives us
:<math>
\begin{align}
\left[\begin{array}{cc}
a & b \\ c & d
\end{array}\right]\left[\begin{array}{c} s\\t \end{array}\right] &= \left[\begin{array}{c} as+bt \\ cs+dt \end{array}\right] = s\left[\begin{array}{c} a \\ c\end{array}\right] + t\left[\begin{array}{c} b \\ d\end{array}\right]
\end{align}
</math>
Comparing to the original equation gives
:<math>
A = \left[\begin{array}{cc}
1 & 3 \\ 2 & -1
\end{array}\right]
</math>
statement_html:
Write the matrix \(A\) so that the equation

\[\begin{aligned} s \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \end{array} \right] + t \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ -1 \end{array} \right] = \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 10 \end{array} \right]\end{aligned}\]

can be represented as a matrix equation,

: A\left[\begin{array}{c} s \\ t \end{array} \right] = \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 10 \end{array} \right].
statement_raw:
Write the matrix <math>A</math> so that the equation
:<math>
s \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \end{array} \right] + t \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ -1 \end{array} \right] = \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 10 \end{array} \right]
</math>
can be represented as a matrix equation,

:<math> A\left[\begin{array}{c} s \\ t \end{array} \right] = \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 10 \end{array} \right].
